summary: This document is a series of forwarded emails from whistleblower Christopher J. Dilorio to various judicial and regulatory recipients, primarily dated July 2021. It contains detailed allegations of SEC corruption, obstruction, and facilitation of securities fraud and money laundering through various public shell companies like Cemtrex, FTE Networks, Parallax Health Sciences, and others. Dilorio accuses specific SEC officials and others of intentionally omitting key evidence and money laundering aspects from their complaints.

persons.name: Christopher J. Dilorio
persons.context: Author of the correspondence, alleging massive SEC corruption and obstruction related to his whistleblower claims on securities fraud and money laundering involving multiple shell companies.

persons.name: Dick Best
persons.context: Repeatedly mentioned as a target of criticism for SEC actions (or inactions) regarding complaints against Cemtrex and other entities, allegedly omitting money laundering details.

persons.name: Lara Shalov Mehraban
persons.context: Named alongside Dick Best as part of the SEC NY team whose complaint against Govil/Cemtrex is criticized for omissions.

persons.name: Aron Govil
persons.context: CEO of Cemtrex and Telidyne, charged by the SEC for fraud involving paid stock recommendations and false claims about mobile apps.

persons.name: John M. Fife
persons.context: Charged by the SEC in 2020 for acquiring/selling billions of penny stock shares without registering as a dealer; linked to investments in Cemtrex and FTE Networks.

persons.name: Julian Tiederman
persons.context: Chairman of Vicon Industries, controlled NIL Funding Corp which engaged in related-party transactions with Vicon that were later involved with Cemtrex.

persons.name: Michael Beys
persons.context: Former EDNY prosecutor and later interim/current CEO of FTE Networks, controlling Cobblestone Ventures LLC which issued a fraud note.

persons.name: Alex Szkaradek
persons.context: CEO of Vision Property Management, sued by NY AG for predatory practices; sold US Home Rentals to FTE Networks in a $350M deal.

persons.name: Antoni Szkaradek
persons.context: Associated with Alex Szkaradek in the Vision Property Management and US Home Rentals transaction with FTE Networks.

persons.name: Eliot Kang
persons.context: Ran Inmost Partners LLC which acquired over $50M in prior issued notes from FTE Networks.

persons.name: Kevin Goodman
persons.context: SEC official overseeing FINRA and securities industry; criticized for producing a 'bullshit order handling complaint' and the Parallax COVID-19 disclosure case, seen as obstruction.

persons.name: Paul Arena
persons.context: CEO of Parallax Health Sciences, charged by the SEC for misleading COVID-19 disclosures; has history with other shell companies like Augme.

persons.name: Nathaniel Bradley
persons.context: Executive at Parallax Health Sciences charged alongside Paul Arena for misleading COVID-19 disclosures.

persons.name: Ofer Abarbanel
persons.context: Subject of an SEC complaint for transferring approximately $102 million from investor funds into NARL/State Fund accounts.

persons.name: Nicholas Abbate
persons.context: Former independent market maker at Knight Capital; COO of the State Fund that received the $102 million investor funds, omitted from the SEC's Abarbanel complaint.

persons.name: Jed S. Rakoff
persons.context: SDNY judge who signed a stipulated order and final judgment in a NYAG case against Vision Property Management in January 2020.

persons.name: Mary Kay Vyskocil
persons.context: SDNY judge who dismissed a derivative lawsuit against FTE Networks executives in September 2020 for failure to show demand futility.

persons.name: Vikas Arora
persons.context: IRS Criminal Investigation agent who flew to Denver in April 2016 to meet with Dilorio regarding his TCR.

persons.name: Nate Sarnacki
persons.context: IRS Criminal Investigation agent who flew to Denver in April 2016 with Vikas Arora to meet with Dilorio.

persons.name: Michael Sobeck
persons.context: Prolific financier (Bag Man) associated with Harbor Gates Capital and formerly Tangiers, involved as a selling shareholder in Parallax's June 2019 offering.

persons.name: Richard Rosenblum
persons.context: Controls The Cobran LLC and Harborview Advisors; involved in Parallax offering and other shells like Innovative Payment Solutions (IPSI).

persons.name: Milton Ault
persons.context: Controls DPW Holdings (now Ault Group), parent of Digital Power Lending, a seller in the Parallax offering.

persons.name: Barry Honig
persons.context: Mentioned as a prolific financier (Bag Man) who is allegedly not out of business, connected to Russian entities and Signature Bank.

connections.description: Work together at the SEC NY office on the complaint against Govil/Cemtrex, which Dilorio criticizes for omissions.
Fife's entities (Iliad, etc.) invested in Govil's company Cemtrex in June 2019, as per SEC filings.
Associated in Vision Property Management and the sale of US Home Rentals to FTE Networks.
FTE Networks acquired US Home Rentals from Alex and Antoni Szkaradek for $350M in stock, notes, and preferred stock in December 2019.
Dilorio accuses Goodman of obstruction, citing a delayed 'order handling' complaint after Dilorio submitted his TCR, and a superficial Parallax COVID complaint.
Abarbanel transferred $102M in investor funds to accounts at the State Fund/New York Alaska, where Abbate was COO.
Co-executives at Parallax Health Sciences charged together by the SEC for misleading COVID-19 disclosures.

events.title: SEC Charges Aron Govil, Cemtrex, and Telidyne
events.description: SEC files charges against Aron Govil for fraud involving paid stock recommendations for Cemtrex and false claims about Telidyne mobile apps for crypto and COVID-19.

events.title: Cemtrex Announces Purported Key Tronic Acquisition
events.description: Cemtrex issues a press release announcing an exchange offer for Key Tronic Corporation shares, which Key Tronic later disavows, stating they were unaware of Cemtrex.

events.title: Cemtrex Acquires 46% of Vicon Industries
events.description: Cemtrex claims acquisition of 46% stake in Vicon Industries, allegedly by purchasing a position from NIL Funding Corp that had just been sold to the public in a January 2018 offering.

events.title: SEC Charges John M. Fife and Companies
events.description: SEC charges John M. Fife and his controlled companies for acquiring and selling over 21 billion shares of penny stock without registering as a securities dealer.

events.title: Rakoff Judgment in NYAG vs. Vision Property Management
events.description: Judge Jed Rakoff signs a stipulated order and final judgment in NYAG case against Vision Property Management, requiring restitution and enjoining certain activities.

events.title: Vyskocil Dismisses FTE Networks Derivative Suit
events.description: Judge Mary Kay Vyskocil dismisses with prejudice a derivative lawsuit against FTE Networks executives for failure to allege demand futility.

events.title: IRS CI Agents Meet Dilorio in Denver
events.description: IRS CI agents Vikas Arora and Nate Sarnacki fly from Chicago to Denver to meet with Christopher Dilorio regarding his TCR submissions.

events.title: SEC Approves Parallax S-1 Offering
events.description: SEC approves a Parallax Health Sciences S-1 registration statement for an offering with multiple selling shareholders, including entities Dilorio identifies as 'Bag Men'.

events.title: Riot Blockchain Acquires Whinstone US from Northern Data
events.description: Riot Blockchain completes acquisition of Whinstone US, a Texas data center, from Northern Data AG, with Northern Data becoming a 12% holder in RIOT.

locations: Bond Collective | Greenpoint, 276 Greenpoint Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11222
40 Wall Street, New York, NY (associated with EMA/Trump)
1218 Union Street, Brooklyn, NY 11225 (LG Capital/Payrix address)
keyFacts: The whistleblower, Christopher J. Dilorio, alleges the SEC is a 'grossly corrupt, criminal organization' that actively facilitates massive, ongoing securities fraud and money laundering through public shell companies while obstructing his whistleblower claims.

Dilorio claims the SEC's complaint against Aron Govil/Cemtrex intentionally omits key evidence, such as a 2017 letter from Key Tronic disavowing any knowledge of Cemtrex, and fails to mention money laundering.

The document details a pattern of 'sham transactions' and 'fraud notes' used to create billions of worthless shares in shells like FTE Networks, which were then dumped on the public via executing broker-dealers like NITE and UBS, facilitated by illegal naked shorting.

Dilorio asserts that SEC officials like Dick Best, Lara Shalov Mehraban, and Kevin Goodman intentionally limit investigations, omit key players and money laundering aspects from complaints, and produce superficial charges (e.g., 'COVID disclosures') to cover up larger corruption.

The correspondence references connections between the alleged schemes and other high-profile cases/entities, including 1MDB, Trump, Russian spies, Chinese nationals, and figures like Barry Honig and John M. Fife, suggesting a wide network of financial crime.
